channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fund managers have never turned so pessimistic this quickly on U.S. stocks, a survey finds
item.description: Fund managers have quickly become pessimistic on U.S. stocks after the introduction of Trump administration tariffs.

item.title: Kore.ai teams with G42’s Inception to develop AI-powered products for the enterprise
item.description: Kore.ai announced a strategic partnership with Inception, a division of UAE-based G42, to jointly develop AI-powered products for the enterprise.

item.title: Cohere launches Embed 4: New multimodal search model processes 200-page documents
item.description: Cohere updated its model Embed 4 so enterprises can make embeddings from multimodal data sources and even longer documents.

item.title: Moveworks joins AI agent library craze
item.description: Moveworks said its AI Agent Marketplace will make it easier for organizations to think of new agentic use cases.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson raises sales outlook, even with tariff costs accounted for
item.description: J&J beat quarterly profit and revenue expectations and raised its dividend but didn’t change its profit outlook, and the stock pulled back.

item.title: Citigroup CEO is betting the U.S. economy can weather the tariff storm
item.description: Citi’s Jane Fraser looks past the current trade-policy turmoil and says the dollar will retain its position as global reserve currency.

item.title: Ericsson’s stock is climbing after strong results. Thank tariff stockpiling.
